text.content: Due to Institute policy, minors (under 18) who are not students at Georgia Tech may not attend HackGT 7.

questions.name: 18-and-gt-student
questions.label: Are you over 18 or a student at Georgia Tech?
options: I am under 18 and a Georgia Tech student.

questions.name: phone-number
questions.label: What’s a cell phone number we can contact you at during the event? (We will only use this for informational and emergency announcements)

questions.name: university
questions.label: What university do you attend?
options: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
Missouri University of Science and Technology
Queens College, City University of New York
Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina at Charlotte
University of North Carolina at Greensboro
University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center
University of Texas at El Paso
University of Texas at San Antonio
Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

questions.name: year
questions.label: What is your year in school?

questions.name: major
questions.label: What is your major?
options: Literature, Media, and Communication & Digital Media

questions.name: gender
questions.label: I identify as ...

questions.name: race
questions.label: What is your race/ethnicity?

questions.name: timezone
questions.label: What time zone will you be located in during HackGT 7 (Oct 16th-18th)?
options: Puerto Rico and US Virgin Islands Time

questions.name: marketing
questions.label: How did you find us?

questions.name: resume
questions.label: Please upload your resume or a skill sheet

questions.name: passion
questions.label: If money, time, and technical aptitude were not limiting factors, what would you build? It doesn’t have to be computer science related; be creative!

questions.name: perseverance
questions.label: Tell us about a time you persevered to achieve a goal, big or small. How did you stay engaged throughout the challenges you faced? Feel free to write about any topic, not just computer science.

questions.name: creativity
questions.label: Now, let’s depart from reality. If you could live in any fantasy or imaginary world, which one would it be and why?

questions.name: required-items
questions.label: Please confirm the following:
options: I have read and agree to adhere to the [MLH Code of Conduct](https://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf)
I agree to the [HackGT Photo Release Waiver](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gLMUiSMDEDFvgibvYSojRsohr65L9TzB/view?usp=sharing)

questions.name: other
questions.label: Anything else you'd like us to know?

questions.label: Have you attended HackGT as a mentor before?

questions.name: ta
questions.label: Have you ever worked as a tutor, teaching assistant or similar before? If so, what was your title, and how long did you have this position?

questions.name: skills
questions.label: What skills and topics do you feel comfortable mentoring in?

questions.name: who-mentor
questions.label: Who do you want to mentor?

questions.name: why-mentor
questions.label: What motivates you to mentor participants at this event?

questions.name: help-participants
questions.label: Many hackers stop hacking when they get stuck on problems they do not know how to solve. As a mentor, what is your approach to (1) guide hackers to a solution and (2) encourage them to keep hacking?

questions.name: teach
questions.label: Describe a time you taught something technical to someone with no/very little experience with the topic (can be in informal setting).

questions.name: availability
questions.label: When are you available to mentor during the event?
